meanings.definition: To make something abstract more concrete or real.
meanings.sent1: She reified her dream of becoming a doctor by enrolling in medical school.
meanings.sent2: The artist reified his emotions into a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent3: The magician reified his thoughts into a tangible illusion.
meanings.sent4: Her determination reified into a solid plan for success.
meanings.sent5: The architect reified his vision into a stunning skyscraper.

meanings.definition: To treat something abstract as if it were a concrete object.
meanings.sent1: He reified his fear of failure by avoiding challenges.
meanings.sent2: The child reified his imaginary friend as a real companion.
meanings.sent3: The chef reified his recipe as a sacred text.
meanings.sent4: The author reified her characters into living, breathing beings.
meanings.sent5: The scientist reified his hypothesis into a groundbreaking experiment.
